intro: Oldenlandia scabrida, commonly known as roughleaf spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in clusters, often in shades of white, pink, or purple. The plant has opposite, rough-textured leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Oldenlandia scabrida is a member of the family Commelinaceae, which includes other ornamental and medicinal plants.
